abstract: 'A man can no more forget his father and grandfather than a river can forget its source'.
description: At age 11 Denise Mack is told secretly by her mother that her heritage isn't Irish, that her grandfather was Lebanese and her grandmother, Chinese. Through this story, Denise journeys along the path of her ancestry to bring her closer to herself.
